greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers n such that 2^n - 5 is prime.
comment: Except 3, all terms are even since for odd n, 2^n - 5 is divisible by 3.
link: Keith Conrad, Square patterns and infinitude of primes, University of Connecticut, 2019.
Henri Lifchitz & Renaud Lifchitz (Editors), Search for 2^n-5, PRP Top Records
results.author: _Andrey V. Kulsha_, Jan 30 2001
ext: a(35)-a(40) from _Max Alekseyev_, a(41) from Paul Underwood, a(42)-a(46) from _Henri Lifchitz_, added by _Max Alekseyev_, Feb 09 2012
